er_text: How does this not have Yelp Reviews?   It's an amazing "museum" to visit in NYC.   Named after the famed banker, the Pierpont Morgan is a veritable history lesson in itself.  It wouldn't be hard to create a semester long class based on what's inside.  There is a whole series of educational classes for kids.   Exhibits for adults.  Currently there's a Warhol exhibit that's very interesting.   Morgan had a collection that was both huge and varied.  As a result the shows here vary.  The permanent collection highlights many of his works and show the broad range he had as a collector.  The Morgan continues to grow and acquire too.  As pieces that would fit in become available the Morgan collection may pick them up.  I'd recommend taking one of their tours if you go.  You will leave understanding the collection and probably wanting more.

The private collection of books in the library is amazing. I can't explain the historic significance of the works compiled by Mr. Morgan. The value in dollars is beyond belief. Anyone that loves the feel of a book in their hands will appreciate visiting the library. You can't touch but at least you would be able to envy the collection. Mr. Morgan definitely had good taste in authors. The comfort of having a library in your home would give any book lover a reason to be jealous. Floor to ceiling books. Beautiful wooden historic bookshelves. When you visit the museum you must see the library. Sorry no photos allowed in the library.
